== Messaging Scenarios ==

Test cases take from <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/DesktopTeam/Meeting/JauntyIndicatorAppletTestCases| here]]</nowiki>

These test cases focus on evolution and pidgin.
* Q: Are IM's and IRC pings meant to be handled in the same manner?
** I would say yes, and right now they do

=== Test Case 1: No IM Window when IM Received ===
The user has pidgin running, but no pdgin windows are open.
* Confirm that a notification appears when the IM comes in.
** Confirmed
* Confirm that an entry is added to the MI
** Confirmed
* Confirm that the IM Window does not open
** Fail, it did open (<nowiki>[[http://launchpad.net/bugs/342410|bug 34210]]</nowiki>)
* Confirm that when the entry is selected, the IM window opens and comes to the front
** It was already open

=== Test Case 2: IM Window Open/Not active when Im Received ===
* Confirm that a notification appears when the IM comes in.
** Confirmed
* Confirm that an entry is added to the MI
** Confirmed
* Confirm that the IM Window does not come to the front
** Confirmed
* Confirm that when the entry is selected, the IM window opens and comes to the front
** Confirmed

=== Test Case 3: User is writing into an IM window when another friend IM's them ===
* Confirm that a notification does not appear
** Fail, I did get the notification (<nowiki>[[http://launchpad.net/bugs/342420|bug 342420]]</nowiki>)
* Confirm that a new pidgin tab appears with the new IM
** Confirmed

=== Test Case 4: User is writing into an IM window when the friend they are chatting with IM's them ===
* Confirm that a notification does not appear
** Confirmed
* Confirm that the new message appears in the current chat window
** Confirmed

=== Test Case 5: Evolution window is not active, email received ===
* Confirm that a notification appears when the email arrives
** Confirmed
* Confirm that an entry is added to the MI
** Fail (<nowiki>[[http://launchpad.net/bugs/342480|bug 342480]]</nowiki>)
* Confirm that evolution does not come to the front
** Confirmed
* Confirm that when the entry is selected, the evolution window comes to the front
** There is no entry for the incoming message, but when selecting Evolution in the MI it does come to the front

=== Test Case 6: Evolution Window is not active, user is writing an email, email received ===
* Confirm that a notification appears when the email arrives
** Confirmed
* Confirm that an entry is added to the MI
** Fail (<nowiki>[[http://launchpad.net/bugs/342480|bug 342480]]</nowiki>)
* Confirm that the main evolution does not come to the front
** Confirmed
* Confirm that when the entry is selected, the main evolution window comes to the front
** There is no entry for the incoming message, but when selecing Evolution in the MI it does come to the front

=== Test Case 7: Evolution Window is active, email received ===
* Confirm that a notification does not appear
** Fail (<nowiki>[[http://launchpad.net/bugs/342429|bug 342429]]</nowiki>)
* Confirm that the new message appears in the main evolution window
** Confirmed

=== Test Case 8: The user starts up Ubuntu, and neither pidgin or evolution are open ===
* Confirm the MI applet is empty (no icon)
** Confirmed

=== Test Case 9: The user starts up just pidgin ===
* Confirm the MI applet shows an icon and lists "Pidgin Instant Messenger" when left clicked
** Confirmed

=== Test Case 10: The user starts up just evolution ===
* Confirm the MI applet shows an icon and lists "Evolution Mail" when left clicked
** Confirmed

=== Test Case 11: The user starts up both pidgin and evolution ===
* Confirm the MI applet shows an icon and lists "Pidgin Instant Messenger" when left clicked
** Confirmed
* Confirm the MI applet shows an icon and lists "Evolution Mail" when left clicked
** Confirmed

=== Test Case 12: Pidgin buddy list ===
* User launches pidgin with Applications->Internet->Pidgin (or automatically at login)
** Confirmed
* Buddy list opens
** Confirmed
* User closes buddy list
** Confirmed
* User can confirm Pidgin is running by clicking on the indicator applet
** Confirmed
* User can open the buddy list by clicking in the indicator applet
** Confirmed
* User can close the buddy list and confirm Pidgin is still running by looking at the indicator applet
** Confirmed
* Confirm the only way to exit pidgin is with Buddies->Quit in the buddy list window
** Confirmed
